Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: Draw a plant that has been watered and show that the plant is healthy and growing with detailed elements like bright green leaves and a strong stem.
Draw a plant that has not been watered and depict it as unhealthy and wilting with drooping leaves and a browning color.
Add details to the drawings to emphasize that plants need water to live and grow, such as soil moisture and a watering can symbol.
Use colors and labels effectively to highlight the differences between healthy, hydrated plants and wilted, unwatered ones.
Draw a sun to clearly show that plants also need light to grow, complementing their need for water.
CANNOT: Show any inconsistency in correctly labeling or coloring certain plant parts that are significant (e.g., might forget to label the roots or stem on occasion due to minor oversight).
